description: From Middle English scourer, skourer, scowrrere, equivalent to scour +â€Ž -er.

entries.meaning: A tool used to scour, usually used to clean cookware.
examples: A scourer may be in the form of a mesh (ball) of wires, a flat piece of a rough fabric, or a pad with a soft sponge-like side and a more abrasive side.

entries.meaning: Agent noun of scour; a person who scours.
(obsolete) A rover or footpad; a prowling robber.
